intro: Diototheca, commonly known as the "buttercup daisy," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that typically feature yellow centers and white or pale pink petals. The plants are native to various regions in Africa and are often found in grassy or rocky habitats. Diototheca species are generally herbaceous, with upright stems and small, alternate leaves. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
